page.title: 03Bourtie Kirk
page.content: Records show that there ws kirk (church) in Bourtie in 1190 but the present Kirk was rebuilt in 1806. The Church of Scotland minister from Oldmelrum, two miles away, takes services here on the first and third Sundays of each month and, although the parishes of Bourtie and Meldrum are oficially united, most of the 60 members of the Kirk in Bourtie attend services in Bourtie, hold their own harvest thanksgiving day and probide their own church activities. The minister preaches from a Georgian triple-decker pulpit. A small gallery upstairs and oak-panelled family pews downstairs provide space for around 100 people, but between 12 and 20 normally attended services, numbers can be as high as 50 for Christmas and communion services, or for infrequent wedding or christening services.
